column4: where can I find the 'regular java 6 from sun/oracle'? it's not in my synaptic packet manager :(
add the partner repo!
I added the partner repo
sudo apt-get update
the warning about duplicate sources.list entry is that important?
not really, it will work with them being there.  You probably added partner twice (or something else)?  It's not critical at all.
what about the suggestion to run apt-get update?
it's not going to fix the problem unfortunately, kinda a misleading message.  "gksu gedit /etc/apt/sources.list" and remove the duplicate if you wish.
thx
glad to help.
anyway, there still is no sun java 6 in the list after runnign the apt-get update command
from a terminal try "apt-cache search sun-java" to show all Sun Java packages
why are those packages not in the synaptic list?
are you looking for the web plugin?  or the jre / jdk?
don't know about the synaptic issue... sorry.
jre = runtime environment, while jdk = development files
what are you trying to do?
client of a server i don't understand?  is this for a web browser (if so install the plugin)?  is this to run java (if so install the jre)?  is this to develop using java (install the jdk)?
what is the "regular" java 6?
sorry you'd need to be more specific.  they are all "regular"
? that doesn't help - i'm not sure if you need jre or jdk - you could try both i guess.
then start with the sun-java6-jre (or if you need it in a web browser, also install sun-java6-plugin)
thanks I think I got it really well fixed now
